content.description: A series of 3 left-trending cracks makes for some easy warm-up climbing.
content.location: Tucked just behind the "Charlie" boulder. There is a trail leading there on the downhill side of the Sweet Tooth boulder.

content.description: Climb up to the pockets and jump to the only good hold. Move intently at the top and it's a piece of cake.
content.location: The 20' boulder downhill from Sweet Tooth, towards the far right of the boulder.

content.description: Start low on inconvenient feet and work the holds out left to gain the crack in the rock that leads to the attractive vertical rail feature. Do not top out straight above unless it has been cleaned. Instead, traverse right into the finish of "Taste the Rainbow" and top out there.
content.protection: Chalk, and pads if you like those.
content.location: The tall, 20' boulder down the hill from Sweet Tooth.

content.description: Sit start just to the right of the arete. Make sure those eye holes are dry, lest you get a bit damp in the eyes yourself.
content.location: One of the first boulders you come to, just climbers left of Rock Candy.

content.description: This problem tops out the same as rock candy left, but starts further to the right with a sit start on a full pad positive crimp. Tech out some balancy gaston moves and top out via undercling.
content.location: Directly to the right of Rock Candy (left) on the sweet tooth boulder.

content.description: Stand start matched on a small angling edge and bust a reachy move to a good hold out right. Finesse the undercling and enjoy the easy topout..
content.location: This and rock candy (right) are the first problems you will see as you approach the sweet tooth boulder from the trail.

content.description: This problem has much to teach if you have the patience to learn. Sit start under the eye and slap to the good crimp. The rest is gravy.
content.location: The boulder sitting to the left when looking at Rock Candy. This problem is located on the same boulder and to the left of Seeping Eye Sockets.

content.description: Short, overhanging compression with a burly topout to boot.
content.location: This problem is located in a cluster of boulders on a hill close to the cliff line. There is a faint trail that leads to these boulders from Seeping Eye Sockets, or you can hike straight up the hill from the Warmup Cracks.

content.description: Start on Taste the Rainbow and traverse the pockets into Sugar High. Stellar finger-work on this one!
Sit start between two big rocks and climb up to the horizontal break in the boulder. Find the good hold out left then crank to the top using only face holds.
content.location: The big boulder that can be seen to the right of Sugar High.

content.description: Start in the sloper below the big iron eye and climb to the top.
content.location: To the right of the boulder with Taste the Rainbow and to the left of the boulder with Fizzy Lift, this boulder is tucked away safe and sound.

content.description: Climb the arete to the left of fizzy lift.
content.location: This boulder is just downhill from Sweet Tooth.

content.description:
This problem climbs the large, Africa shaped hollow flake in the corridor next to the Warmup Cracks.

 This feature is just for looking and will not hold up to repeated climbs.  If you are going to climb this, try to avoid using the Africa flake at all, as it is completely hollow and WILL rip off and destroy your face.
content.protection: Nothing will save you from a 50lb flake falling on your face.

content.description: This is a patch of largely overlooked, but high-quality boulders in the Candy Mountain area. They are within a stones throw from the classic sport routes Achilles Heel and Willy Wonka, simply begging to be pulled on.
